text:
i just learned that you can do
> 
>   ...
>   <map:match pattern="images/*.gif" name="root">
>      <map:act type="resource-exists">
>        <map:parameter name="url" value="images/{1}.gif">
>        <!-- new level -->
>        <map:read src="images/{#root:1}.gif" mime-type="images/gif"/>
>      </map:act>
>   </map:match>
>   ...
> 
> http://wiki.apache.org/cocoon/SitemapVariableSubstitution
> 
> (notice the {#root:1}). given that our sitemaps are quite complex, and a 
> lot of internal requests happen, wouldnt it make sense to name pipelines 
> and use this syntax?
creator: gregor@apache.org
gregor@apache.org
text:
we need to find out if these names are sitemap-local or global because we do a
lot of cross-sitemap variable substitution.
